turns.speaker: FLEMMING
turns.text: Okay, boys and girls, our suspects are on a tour bus we believe to be headed for...  the White House! Jumpin' Jesus! I want everyone there. Our people. Locals. Orders are shoot to kill. Repeat! Shoot to kill!

turns.speaker: BORK
turns.text: Chief, I swear, we tore that bus apart. They couldn't have...

turns.speaker: FLEMMING
turns.text: Bork, when this is all over, remind me to make you an appointment with Agent Hurley.

turns.speaker: BORK
turns.text: Not on him, Chief.

turns.speaker: FLEMMING
turns.text: Agent Hurley...

turns.speaker: BORK
turns.text: Say chief, isn't that guy whose camper,...I mean, off in whose...

turns.speaker: FLEMMING
turns.text: Not now Bork.

turns.speaker: BORK
turns.text: We just cleared all four floors. No sign of him.

turns.speaker: FLEMMING
turns.text: Damn! Where the hell is he? We should've found him by now.

turns.speaker: BORK
turns.text: Chief, look!

turns.speaker: FLEMMING
turns.text: Attention all units. We've got him. He's in front of a camper in the visitor's lot.

turns.speaker: FLEMMING
turns.text: OK, nobody shoot. He could still have the unit on him. Keep your distance. We don't wanna take a chance on hitting it.

turns.speaker: BORK
turns.text: Where are his pants?

turns.speaker: FLEMMING
turns.text: Who knows?

turns.speaker: MUDDY
turns.text: Well, Earl said you guys were young, but jeez... Oh well, as long as you can get the job done. So what are your names?

turns.speaker: BUTT-HEAD
turns.text: Uh, Butt-Head.

turns.speaker: BUTT-HEAD
turns.text: Do her? Huh huh.

turns.speaker: MUDDY
turns.text: That's right. I'm offering you ten grand plus expenses to do my wife. We gotta deal?

turns.speaker: MUDDY
turns.text: Here she is. Her name's Dallas. She ain't as sweet as she looks. She stole everything from me. Ya gotta watch out, 'cause she'll do you twice as fast as you'd do her.

turns.speaker: BUTT-HEAD
turns.text: Whoa, huh huh. Cool.

turns.speaker: MUDDY
turns.text: She's holed up in a hotel room in Las Veags. Your flight leaves in a couple of hours. Now c'mon, I'll drive you to the airport.

turns.speaker: BUTT-HEAD
turns.text: Holed up. Huh huh huh. Holed.

turns.speaker: MUDDY
turns.text: One more thing. Mah wife's got this leather satchel. It's black, about this big. I need ya to bring it back. It's real important. Sentimental value... Any questions so far?

turns.speaker: BUTT-HEAD
turns.text: Uh, yeah. Does she have big hooters?

turns.speaker: MUDDY
turns.text: She sure does.

turns.speaker: BUTT-HEAD
turns.text: This is gonna be cool! Huh huh huh.

turns.speaker: MUDDY
turns.text: Ah'm gonna blow you both to hell!

turns.speaker: BUTT-HEAD
turns.text: Cool, huh huh.  Hey Beavis that's that dude that's paying us to do his wife.

turns.speaker: BUTT-HEAD
turns.text: Cool. Huh huh huh.

turns.speaker: MARTHA
turns.text: It's so nice to meet young men who are so well mannered.

turns.speaker: BUTT-HEAD
turns.text: Cool, huh huh huh.

turns.speaker: MARTHA
turns.text: That's why I'm bussing it across America. I'm so glad you're here.  Jim, I want you to meet two nice boys.

turns.speaker: MARTHA
turns.text: This is Travis and Bob... What's your last name, dear?

turns.speaker: BUTT-HEAD
turns.text: Uh... Head? huh huh. My first name's Butt. Huh huh huh.

turns.speaker: MARTHA
turns.text: Meet Sylvia. And Elloise and Sam. And Ed. And Doreen.

turns.speaker: BUTT-HEAD
turns.text: Are you guys sluts too? Huh huh huh.

turns.speaker: BUTT-HEAD
turns.text: Whoa, this kicks ass! Huh huh huh.

turns.speaker: MARTHA
turns.text: Yoo-hoo! Travis and Bob Head. Whoo-hoo!

turns.speaker: DUMB GUY
turns.text: Uh, hey. One of you kids got a match?

turns.speaker: BUTT-HEAD
turns.text: Uh, my butt and your...uh, butt.

turns.speaker: BUTT-HEAD
turns.text: You were a roadie for Motley Crue?

turns.speaker: DUMB GUY
turns.text: Yup. Huh huh.

turns.speaker: BUTT-HEAD
turns.text: Really? That's where we're from.

turns.speaker: DUMB GUY
turns.text: Well, then you know what I'm talking about. Anyway, here's the story. I scored with these two chicks. True story.

turns.speaker: BUTT-HEAD
turns.text: You scored with two chicks?!

turns.speaker: DUMB GUY
turns.text: Yeah, they were sluts. Huh huh huh.

turns.speaker: DUMB GUY
turns.text: Shut up, dumb-ass! You didn't score. I scored with both of them...

turns.speaker: BUTT-HEAD
turns.text: Uh, do you think these two sluts still live in Highland? That would be cool.

turns.speaker: DUMB GUY
turns.text: Hey, you wanna see something really cool? Huh huh huh.

turns.speaker: DALLAS
turns.text: You got two seconds!

turns.speaker: BUTT-HEAD
turns.text: Uh, huh huh. Is that gonna be enough time?

turns.speaker: DALLAS
turns.text: Who sent ya?

turns.speaker: BUTT-HEAD
turns.text: Uh, huh huh, this fat dude. He said we could do you. And he was gonna pay us.

turns.speaker: DALLAS
turns.text: Muddy! Sonofabitch! Hold it. What's he payin' ya?

turns.speaker: BUTT-HEAD
turns.text: Uh, ten uh...

turns.speaker: DALLAS
turns.text: Ten grand? That cheap-ass... I got a better deal for ya. I'll double it. I'll pay ya twenty if you go back there and do mah husband.

turns.speaker: BUTT-HEAD
turns.text: Uh, you want us to do a guy? Huh huh. No way.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Maybe I am three-eighty-five if you carry a second lien!  I can arrange the most creative financing in the six states of New England.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: No, Jane.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: You'll be rich!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: We're rich in what really matters.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Adam my booyy!  When you're really rich in what matters...  ... nothing matters!  My buyer has just made a killing in condos in the Village.  And he's got a little stress problem...  ... so his wife says they want the old peace and quiet!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: So do I, Jane.  I'm on vacation.

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Does that mean you'd consider it in two weeks?  You don't have to answer now.  He wants me to check the deed restriction anyway.  You take your vacation, Adam.  Say 'bye!

turns.speaker: JANE
turns.text: Get <u>away</u> you little monster.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I will <u>never</u> sell this house. I'll be buried in my yard next to Barbara.  Holding hands!  And a good paintbrush!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: She's ready.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Oh, Adam, the model looks so good. The Historical Society will love it.  You've finished the streets?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Almost.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Manchurian Tung oil?  Where did you get it?

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Helen got it for me in Oslo.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: God... Manchurian Tung oil? There's enough to refinish the gateleg table <u>and</u> the cherry wardrobe!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Yeah, I want to get one coat on the wardrobe and then I'll help you.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Oh, honey, I'm so glad we're spending our vacation at home.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: God, how I have looked forward to this, honey.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Oh no.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: It's <u>your</u> turn, darling.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Jane said we should sell the house to someone with a family.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Ah, the ever-tactful Jane.  Let's just relax about having children.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: We should be flattered that she wants to sell our house.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: I know... I just wish she'd leave us alone.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Let's not think about it.  We'll have a nice romantic, quiet, vacation.  Here comes the bridge chorus.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Wave at the lion.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Don't forget the balls, Ernie.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Adam!

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Adam, your Bozman Building is a beauty.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Yeah it turned out okay.  We applied for a National Historical plaque for it.  That'll be the third one on Main Street.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: You're doing it, Adam.  You're saving this town.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Slow down there, honey... I don't want the vibration to weaken the model.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Oh... I'm sorry...

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: This fire wasn't burning when we left the house.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: How's your arm?

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: I'm not sure.  It feels... frozen.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: You'd better sit down, hon.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: I am sitting.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I'll tell you what, Barbara.  I don't think we survived that crash.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Oh, Adam.  We're home.  In our own house.  Nonsense.  I'll make some coffee.  You get some more firewood.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: You saved my -- uh -- life... or whatever... something.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Two hours.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: That's how long you were gone.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: ... Hmmm?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Anything happen while I was away?

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Yes it did.  Yes it did.  I made a couple of small discoveries. Here's one.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Handbook for the recently diseased.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: De<u>ceased</u>.  I don't know where it came from.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Look at the publisher.  Handbook for the Recently Deceased Press.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: I don't think we survived the crash.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: This is going to take some time.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: I don't like situations like this. I hate it when I'm not in control. So just tell me the basics.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: This book isn't arranged that way. What do you want to know?

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: There are a thousand things... Why did you disappear when you walked off the front porch?  Is this a punishment?  Are we halfway to heaven or are we halfway to hell? And how long is this going to <u>last</u>?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I don't see anything about 'Rewards and Punishments' or 'Heaven and Hell.'  This book reads like stereo instructions!  Listen to this... 'Geographical and Temporal Perimeters... Functional perimeters vary from manifestation to manifestation.'  This is going to take some time.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Cabin fever, hon?

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: I can't clean anything.  The vacuum is out in the garage.  I can't leave the house.  Why don't they tell us something?  Where are all the other dead people in the world?  Why is it just you and me?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Maybe this is heaven.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: In heaven there wouldn't be dust on the wallpaper.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Hon... I didn't want to die, but really, this is fine with me.  As long as I never have to wash dishes again.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Dishes?  We haven't eaten in three weeks!  Adam, I'm not like you, I really need to be around <u>people</u>, get out to the church and go grocery shopping.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: But I'm not hungry, are you?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: God, it's Jane Butterfield!

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: What's she doing here?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I don't know.  <u>Jane, Jane, up here</u>!

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: She can't see you, right?  In the book, Rule Number Two: the living usually won't see the dead.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Won't?  Or can't?

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Just says 'won't.'  Wait a minute. Here it says 'the living are arrogant... they think they'll never die, so they refuse to see the dead.'

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Arrogant.  That's Jane Butterfield all right...

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: At least we won't have to worry about her.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: I guess... if I'm going to be dead, I'll just have to be the best dead person ever!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: That's my girl!

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Adam, we <u>are</u> in hell.  I hate these people.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: They make gypsies look good.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Is this a punishment for something we did in life?  What can we do?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I don't know if there's anything we can do.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: We're not completely helpless. I've been reading the book. There's a word for people in our predicament, honey.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Oh, honey, we may need that.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: No, I'm not putting up with this.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Barbara, honey!  Don't go out there.  You don't know --

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Whatever it is it can't be worse than this.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Oh, Adam, don't ever leave me alone.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: <u>You</u> left me.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: I know.  I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: We're trapped in this house forever... with those... people.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: You can't say that for sure.  It could be a transitional thing. Like a post-life crisis.  We just have to be tougher with them. Come on.  Have some brandy. Spirits, get it?

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Death didn't improve your sense of humor.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Look in the index... maybe there's, like an emergency number or something.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Not really...  what's this?

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: That's it?  No number, or instructions?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Nothing.  The bio buster?  I don't get it...

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: That little girl saw us.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: She couldn't have.  We can't <u>make</u> them see us.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: But she <u>saw</u> us.  I could feel it.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: That's all we need.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: There's nothing we can do.  It's just a matter of time before they unlock this room.  There goes my model.  There goes our last refuge.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: We're not going to wait here like cornered animals.  I can tell you that.  We need help.  I'm going to talk to that little girl.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: What about this Beetle guy?

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: We don't know who he is...  ... I'm going to talk to that little girl.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Are you crazy?  She can't hear you.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: I don't know... what are you looking up?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: We need some help.  I found something this morning.  Here. Emergencies.  'In case of emergency, draw door.'

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Draw door?  I don't know why we keep looking in that stupid book.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Yet another triumph for Adam and Barbara in the afterlife.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Wait.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: ... Not what I expected when we walked through that door.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: No.  But it's somewhere without big worms.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: My God, we're back where we started.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Look at this, everything is different down here.  All our furniture is gone.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: How long do you suppose we were waiting?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: We'd like some help in getting rid of the people who moved in here.  Barbara and I worked very hard on this house.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: We probably wouldn't mind sharing the house with people who were --

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: That guy is in our cemetery.  Oh, Adam.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Look, she's right.  We'll just start simple, honey, be tougher. I feel... confident.  C'mon.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: God, this is so corny.  Have we been reduced to this?  Sheets?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Think of them as death shrouds. And the moaning is important. Really <u>moan</u>!  Practice, practice, practice.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: I feel really stupid.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: It's <u>not</u> stupid.  We're ghosts. Do you want this woman for breakfast for 125 years?  Moan louder!

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Well, I don't know... We don't get many visitors.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Where are your skulls and bones?

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: You know you're really a pretty girl.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Lydia's trying, but they don't believe her.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: She's got <u>photos</u>, Barbara.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Adam, you had a photo of Big Foot!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: This is different.  Eventually she'll take someone to the attic. And then what?  We've got to try to contact this guy Betelmyer. We gotta get some help, hon.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Did you copy these gravestones right, Adam?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Of course I did.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Then it should be here.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Here's something.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I didn't do that one... Hmmm.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: ... Yes this must be him.  Look... Betelgeuse... Betelgeuse...

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Go ahead... third time's a charm.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: <u>Betelgeuse</u>!

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Three times.  Powerful number.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Bet... el... geuse.  What an awful name.  I thought it was like -- you know.  The <u>juice</u> of <u>beetles</u>.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Has anything been simple so far? From the look of the shovel, we dig.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Oh, Adam.  I don't have gloves.  My nails keep getting longer.  I'll break them.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I guess we open it.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Maybe we should knock first?

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: She's only fourteen...

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: ... acts like she's thirty-five.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Honey.  Let's go.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Go?  What d'ya mean?  We need help.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: No, we don't.  We can work something out ourselves.  We just have to try harder.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Honey, I think that was a mistake.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: I am not going to expose that little girl to that... pervert down there.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: But <u>we</u> let him out.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: I don't care, I've changed my mind.  ... I feel <u>really</u> confident.  We're getting better at this stuff.  We can scare them off ourselves -- tonight!  I've got an idea.  You're going to love it... I'm going to hate it.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: And your sushi was remarkable.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: The sushi?  I did the wine. Didn't you do the sushi?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: N... No,  I just did the Ink Spots.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Who did the sushi?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Maybe they'll leave now.  That snake was a pretty nasty customer.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: He might have hurt somebody.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: But he didn't.  We've got him where we want him.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: <u>Adam</u>!  Why did you build a whorehouse?  Have you ever been to...?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I didn't --

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Lydia, believe me... we know... all the hard stuff is the same over here.  You're going to be who you are... whether you're alive or dead ... and over here -- it's... It's flat... there's no food, no colors ... you can't smell the flowers.  If we knew then what we know now we'd have been more careful...

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: ... we wouldn't have had our little accident.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: You know, I've been thinking.  I could teach Lydia to sew.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Little black party dresses?

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Ah, Adam, you don't know anything about little girls.  She's just... missed out on some love, that's all...

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Let's see if she can get my model back.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: You can build another one... with her.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: We've been given a gift here, honey.  A real live little girl. She likes us a lot.  She needs us. Maybe that's why we died so young, to keep us from getting so... attached to <u>things</u>.  The house, antiques, your model.  Look at us. We didn't have room for anyone.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: What makes you think she likes me?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: What...?

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Just a hunch.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: What time is it?

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: 3:30 I guess.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Give or take a year.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Oh, Adam, don't tease her.  You never got an A in science in your life!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: All right.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: A... Are you the guys who're hiding out in the attic?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: We're ghosts.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Aren't you scared?

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: I'm not scared of Ralph Lauren. Those are <u>sheets</u>.  Are you gross under there?  Are you <u>Night of the</u> <u>Living Dead</u> under there?  Like all bloody veins and pus?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: <u>Night of the Living Dead</u>?  It's this gross movie.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: You can actually see us?  Without the sheets?

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Is this like a trick question?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Nobody else can.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: I'm wearing contacts... Also I read through <u>Handbook for the</u> <u>Recently Deceased</u>.  It says that live people ignore the strange and unusual... not me... <u>I am</u> strange and unusual.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Why are you creeping around Delia's bedroom?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: We were trying to scare your mother.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Stepmother.  I'm very sensitive about being related to reptiles.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: <u>You</u> did this?  You carved all these little figures and houses and things?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I certainly did.  I'd finish it too, but... I don't get out much.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: And this used to be your house, I bet.  Why do you want to scare everybody?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: We want to frighten you away.  So that you'll move out.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: You don't know the Deetzes very well, do you?  My father bought this place.  He never walks away from equity.  Why don't <u>you</u> leave?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: We weren't there.  The handbook says funerals aren't for the dead.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: God, if this is true this is like, amazing!  I kinda like it up here. Can I visit you sometimes?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: You tell them that we are desperate horrible ghoulish creatures who will stop at nothing to get back our house.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Wait a minute.  I had some licorice ice cream earlier.  You guys could be gas.  What if... I'm dreaming. Can you do any neat tricks to prove you're not gas?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: What is going on?

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Really.  I don't know.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Did you get the paint?

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: I got it.  And I took pictures of the new church for you, too.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: We studied all day yesterday. Don't tell me...

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: I got an A!

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: So can I?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Uh-uh.  Only if you got <u>above</u> a C on science.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Oh puh-leeze!

turns.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
turns.text: You don't have an appointment, do you?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: W... We didn't know how to make one.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Nine months?  What difference does that make?

turns.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
turns.text: Good luck.  You're going to use up all your help vouchers.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Help vouchers?

turns.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
turns.text: D-90's.  You spend a hundred and twenty-five years on earth, actually, in that house, during which you get only three class- one D-90 intercessions with Juno. You probably haven't even read through the manual completely yet.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Wait for who?

turns.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
turns.text: For Juno, your caseworker.  Not that it matters to your type.  But there <u>are</u> all these other people here ahead of you.  I'd say three hours.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Aren't you dead?

turns.speaker: BETELGEUSE
turns.text: Hell no!  I'm rolling.  I'm a businessman.  I'm the man what <u>am</u>. <u>Beee</u>tel <u>Jooose</u>!  <u>Who</u> do I gotta kill?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: You don't kill anyone.

turns.speaker: BETELGEUSE
turns.text: <u>So</u> you, the dead, want me, <u>the</u> <u>undead</u>, to throw the live guys -- Mommie, Daddy and Lolita, who might not mind a tumble with an older guy, out into the cold? Even though they have paid hard casharoonie for your dump?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: But... the Deetzes are <u>destroying</u> our house.

turns.speaker: BETELGEUSE
turns.text: You Maitlands are the backbone of the afterlife.  So what's my cut?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Can you scare them off?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Okay.  But that Betelgeuse sure seemed mad.

turns.speaker: BETELGEUSE
turns.text: Hi ho, hi ho, it's off to work I go!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: This is <u>my</u> town.

turns.speaker: BETELGEUSE
turns.text: You wish!  I nearly scored with that little blonde.  I need me a short little queen.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: <u>Barbara</u>?!!

turns.speaker: BETELGEUSE
turns.text: Now, let's get rolling!
